main.bandagedsc: A roll of dressing with a bandage, used to slow down bleeding, stabilize fractures and aid skin healing. Has no effect on muscle health.
main.rippeddressingdsc: A small pile of ripped clothing. Can be used as a makeshift bandage for bleeding wounds.
main.ragdsc: A worn, crumpled up rag. Can be used as decent makeshift dressing.
main.analgesicgauzedsc: Woven gauze made of cotton, containing analgesic drugs. Decent at slowing bleeding and reducing pain from injuries.
main.alginatedsc: Dressing derived from carbohydrate sources released by clinical bacterial species, in the same manner as biofilm formation. Slows bleeding, highly improves skin healing and counteracts infections
main.sterilizedbandagedsc: A roll of dressing with a bandage, used to slow down bleeding, stabilize fractures and aid skin healing. Counteracts infections. Has no effect on muscle health.
main.plasticbandagedsc: A roll of specially synthesized tough material, made to efficiently cover wounds and stabilize fractures. Has no effect on muscle health.
main.adhesivebandagedsc: A pack of small medical dressings, made to treat small injuries. Lowers bleeding.
main.musharmdsc: Inedible plant part, useful as a one-time makeshift bandage.
main.paincreamdsc: A bottle filled with a mix of chemicals and drugs. Instantly relieves pain in the spot where it's used. The effect doesn't last. Also acts as a decent disinfectant for wounds.
main.morphinedsc: A strong opiate. Provides body-wide pain relief, and slows mental activity. Overdose at ~90%.
main.makeshiftlrddsc: A makeshift Localized Resuscitation Device. Looks like it's taped together. Increases the muscle health and disinfects limb it's used on, AND any directly adjacent limbs. Slightly reduces internal bleeding if used on the chest.
main.lrddsc: A Localized Resuscitation Device, made to easily provide effective general trauma care. Increases limb health, slows bleeding, provides pain relieving drugs and disinfects the limb it's used on, along with any adjacent limbs. Highly reduces internal bleeding if used on the chest.
main.opiumdsc: A relatively mild opioid. Provides body-wide pain relief, and slows mental activity. Overdose at over 200%.
main.heroindsc: A strong synthesized opioid drug. Causes euphoria and strong pain relief, but it's easy to overdose on or go into withdrawal after. No dosage info... Not very healthy.
main.naloxonedsc: An opioid antagonist, used in treatment of opiate overdose. Quick treatment might save your life during accidental overdose.
main.naltrexonedsc: A medication, used to treat general ailments like sickness or opiate abuse. Lowers happiness and may cause vomiting.
main.fentanyldsc: A highly potent opiate, 100 times stronger than morphine. Provides body-wide pain relief, and slows mental activity. Overdose at ~20%.
main.painkillersdsc: A bottle with opioids. Lowers all pain for a duration after using. Overdose may cause respiratory failure and difficulty waking.
main.braingrowdsc: A bottle containing special orally-taken medicine that stimulates brain regrowth. Increases brain integrity, but often has serious side effects.
main.autopumpdsc: When used, attaches to your chest, keeps your oxygen at livable levels, and provides adrenaline and energy for 5 minutes, potentially buying you more time. One-time use.
main.autoautopumpdsc: Attaches to your thigh and automatically activates when you go into a critical state, keeping your oxygen at livable levels and providing energy, but only once.
main.antidepressantsdsc: A bottle of potent antidepressants. Makes you feel everything less for some time, and slowly increases happiness. Might have side effects.
main.antibioticsdsc: A bottle with antibiotics. Increases your immunity for some time, counteracting all infections. Upsetting taste.
main.antiserumdsc: A blood serum containing antibodies to fight off most common infections. Increases immunity and helps reduce sepsis. Slightly increases blood volume.
main.antiraddsc: A bottle with special, experimental medicine that directly reduces the effects of radiation when taken. Will require high doses to combat radiation sickness.
main.sleepingpillsdsc: A blister pack containing sleeping pills. The brand name is missing. Makes you able to sleep better when in bad physical condition. Don't combine with other drugs.
main.rosepoddsc: A part of a sand rose. Doesn't spoil. Can be opened.
main.roselightdsc: A bright, far reaching yellow light that came from a sand rose. While it decays fast, it's useful for checking how big a drop is. Also reveals hidden infections if used on a limb.
main.splintdsc: A sturdy board, made to aid fractures. Helps with healing fractures and dislocations.
main.bloodbagdsc: A plastic bag filled with blood, and an auto-injector at the end. Drinking from it is not recommended.
main.bloodsacdsc: A small, fleshy sac with blood in it. Doesn't look too different from your blood. Can be eaten or injected.
main.salinedsc: A mixture of salt and water, often used in treating hypovolemia and thirst. Has a needle at the end.
main.ringersolutiondsc: A solution of several salts dissolved in water for the purpose of creating an isotonic solution relative to the body fluids of an animal. Good for thirst and blood loss.
main.bloodbaghumandsc: A plastic bag filled with weirdly-colored blood, and an auto-injector at the end. Probably not healthy.
main.bloodbagemptydsc: A plastic bag with trace amounts of blood in it. Use in the health panel to fill the bag with blood from your body (0.75L) for later use.
main.reinforcedropedsc: Longer, more durable foliage rope. Used in crafting.
main.flammablepowderdsc: A chalky and highly flammable powder. Useful in making explosives.
main.foliagebagdsc: A very flimsy bag made of tied together foliage.
main.slingbagdsc: A foliage bag with added reinforcements, made to be worn on your back.
main.gravbagdsc: A very experimental container that generates negative gravity in order to reduce the weight of whatever's in it. Has explosive tendencies when its battery nears empty.
main.legpouchdsc: A leather pouch with straps made to go around the thigh. It's like a pocket pocket!
main.pursedsc: A handled medium-sized bag used to carry personal items. Quite stylish!
main.pouchdsc: A small green bag made of woven synthetic fiber. Has no handle.
main.brokenbagdsc: An old, heavily worn school bag. The straps are torn and unusable, rendering the bag unwearable.
main.toolboxdsc: A big, heavy steel box, made to hold tools.
main.medkitdsc: A small box, made to hold medicine.
main.scaffoldingpackdsc: A hyper-compressed box of scaffolding, made to be easily placed down. Lasts 100 uses.
main.disinfectantdsc: A bottle of antiseptic fluid. Counteracts infections.
main.scrapmetaldsc: Bits and pieces of steel from destroyed machinery. Can be placed down. Commonly used as currency between survivors, and for crafting.
main.metalalloydsc: A crudely made slab of molded together metal. Used for advanced crafting. Can be placed down.
main.circuitboarddsc: A bit of circuitry, ripped out of a once working machine. It still sparks occasionally. Used in crafting.
main.bloodcrystalsharddsc: Seeps blood into anything it touches. Slowly increases your blood volume up to normal levels while stored on your body.
main.soothingcrystalsharddsc: It has a calming aura to it. Slowly increases happiness while stored on your body.
main.reliefcrystalsharddsc: You feel a little numb holding it... Decreases pain while stored on your body.
main.turbulentcrystalsharddsc: It vibrates with energy. Increases jump height while stored on your body.
main.oxygencrystalsharddsc: It's bubbling away slowly, releasing oxygen into anything around it... Increases stamina regeneration while stored on your body.
main.emissivecrystalsharddsc: Glows brightly, for a time. Useful as a light source while it lasts.
main.digestioncrystalsharddsc: It feels as if it's taking matter out of your body... Decreases sickness while stored on your body.
main.geofruitdsc: Basic, but tasty fruit. Grows on geo-trees. Low in calories, reduces some thirst and decays fast.
main.stonefruitcloseddsc: A hard green fruit stuck to a hard, gray part of its plant. You need to separate it using your teeth first.
main.stonefruitopendsc: A hard green fruit with a neutral taste and medium fat content. It's very dry, you'll probably be thirsty after it.
main.bananadsc: A tasty yellow fruit, seemingly from another planet. Slightly radioactive.
main.burgerdsc: A big, tasty snack. Fills both your tummy and soul!
main.pizzaslicedsc: A slice of baked pizza. Very tasty, filling and fattening!
main.bucketofchickendsc: A bunch of chicken legs in a bucket. Very filling.
main.steakdsc: A big, nicely cooked and prepared piece of meat. Filling, fattening and tasty!
main.cookiesdsc: A pack of small, baked sweet snacks. Tasty, but not the healthiest.
main.chipsdsc: A pack of thin, baked slices of potato. Tasty, but not the healthiest.
main.cerealdsc: A box of generic cereal. Not exactly fun to eat dry, but it's filling and not repulsive. Slightly increases thirst.
main.bowlofcerealdsc: The world's greatest invention - a bowl of milk and cereal. Very tasty and filling.
main.makeshifthelmetdsc: A rudimentary helmet made out of some rope and stitched together carcasses. Provides some head protection.
main.hardcandydsc: A pack of small, hard candy. Tasty, but not filling.
main.fleshchunkdsc: A giant, very fatty chunk of flesh. Must've came from something big. Very filling and fattening.
main.candybardsc: A nice, tasty candy bar. Lasts long, but not very filling. Might make you sick if overeaten.
main.chocolatebardsc: A bar of unpackaged chocolate. Tasty, but you can't digest it well.
main.waterbottledsc: Plastic bottle with water in it.
main.milkdsc: A white liquid food produced by the mammary glands of mammals, in a carton. Tasty and filling!
main.chocolatemilkdsc: A type of flavoured milk made by mixing it with cocoa solids. Very sweet and tasty, but toxic for your species. Increases happiness, consume with caution.
main.ketchupdsc: A table condiment with a sweet and sour flavor. A little disgusting to drink.
main.waterjugdsc: Big, heavy plastic bottle with water in it. Stores a lot, and doesn't spoil.
main.bleachdsc: Chemical product used to remove color from fiber, or to disinfect. Can be used to disinfect wounds. Drinking is lethal.
main.energydrinkdsc: A tasty, caffeinated drink to give you a boost of stamina and energy. Somewhat toxic for your species, drink with caution.
main.coffeedsc: A beverage brewed from roasted coffee beans. Tasty and stimulating, but rather toxic due to the caffeine content.
main.soupdsc: A closed bowl of unidentifiable soup. Tasty and filling with high water content!
main.sodabottledsc: A tasty, sugary drink, packed in a large bottle.
main.applejuicedsc: A carton of fruit juice made by the maceration and pressing of an apple. Tasty!
main.lemonadedsc: A jar containing a sweetened lemon-flavored drink. Tasty!
main.iceteadsc: A bottle of cold, sweetened decaffeinated tea. Tasty!
main.sodacandsc: A tasty, sugary drink, packed in a small can.
main.alcoholdsc: Glass bottle with unlabeled alcohol in it. Drinkable, but your body can't digest it well at all. Can disinfect wounds.
main.foliagedsc: Generic alien plant life. Barely edible, with a dissatisfying taste. Might make you sick. Decays fast. Often used in crafting.
main.dryfoliagedsc: Seems slightly more appealing to consume when it's dry. Might make you a little sick.
main.glowplantfruitdsc: Bioluminescent and inedible. Has moderately dangerous toxins inside; counteracts infections. Its juice promotes chemical reactions, making it useful in crafting.
main.flashlightdsc: Lights up a large area in front of it, but slowly loses battery. Use to change mode.
main.lanterndsc: A simple, wood and glass lantern with a bright yellow crystal inside of it.
main.lightbulbdsc: An electric light with a filament that is heated until it glows. Seems to be battery powered. Don't put it in your mouth.
main.nutrientbardsc: Solid, edible bar of pure nutrients and calories. Neutral taste, and doesn't spoil.
main.primitivediggingtooldsc: A piece of sharp, heavy metal on a stick. Better at digging than claws.
main.makeshiftdiggingtooldsc: A piece of thrown together and tied up metal, made for digging through rock. It's a bit flimsy.
main.makeshiftheadlampdsc: It's just a glowplant fruit strapped to your forehead. Not exactly comfortable, but frees up some inventory space.
main.shoveldsc: A tool specially crafted to efficiently displace soil and other loose materials. While you haven't seen one of these before in your life, using it isn't exactly a science.
main.woodshoveldsc: A tool specially crafted to efficiently displace soil and other loose materials. Made with a brittle, yet light material.
main.pitchforkdsc: An agricultural tool used to pitch loose material, such as hay, straw, manure, or leaves. Made of steel.
main.woodpitchforkdsc: An agricultural tool used to pitch loose material, such as hay, straw, manure, or leaves. Made of wood.
main.minilaserdrilldsc: A small, consumer-grade laser drill. Not the best at digging, but uses no stamina.
main.heavydrilldsc: A big, heavy, mechanical handheld drill. Very efficient, though lacks range.
main.pickaxedsc: A tool specially crafted to dig rock. Very efficient at removing terrain, though slow.
main.sledgehammerdsc: A tool with a large, flat metal head, attached to a long handle. Not made for digging.
main.woodpickaxedsc: A pickaxe made out of a particularly disappointing material. Efficient at removing terrain, but slow and brittle.
main.wooddiggingtooldsc: A piece of sharpened wood on a stick. Barely better at digging than claws.
main.stickdsc: You're not sure where it came from. Stabbing it into the ground repeatedly is likely negligibly more efficient than clawing at it unarmed.
main.machetedsc: A big, broad metal blade. You feel uneasy holding it.
main.sickledsc: A metal tool with a curved blade, made to harvest crops or cut through vegetation.
main.woodsickledsc: A wooden tool with a curved blade, made to harvest crops or cut through vegetation.
main.rakedsc: Used for softening soil, along other things. Makes you feel like a farmer!
main.clawsdsc: Even though it looks like a toy, it's scarily tough and sharp. You feel like you'd look cool holding it.
main.troweldsc: Primitive gardening tool, made of wood and metal. Probably better than using your claws.
main.woodtroweldsc: Primitive gardening tool, made of wood. Probably better than using your claws...?
main.canteendsc: A refillable canteen. While it is portable, drinking the groundwater from it is still slightly sickening.
main.filtercanteendsc: You just jammed a filter straw into it. Works surprisingly well! Refillable with groundwater.
main.experimentfleshdsc: A ripped piece of flesh from one of your own. Filling, but sickening.
main.ropedsc: A few bits of foliage, tied together into a rope. Used for crafting.
main.animalfleshdsc: A ripped piece of meat from a deceased animal, native to this planet. While it is very similar to your own, it's somewhat edible, even if slightly sickening.
main.internalorgansdsc: A solid compressed ball of displaced internal organs, you can see an orange eyeball sticking out. Looks like they came from a creature sized closely to you. Filling, but horribly disgusting and sickening.
main.blobfleshdsc: Oddly gooey piece of flesh. Filling and tasty! Might make you minorly sick.
main.cactusfleshdsc: Sweet, high in water content and prickly. Tasty and hydrating, but it hurts to eat.
main.neuralboosterdsc: An advanced mix of drugs that alters the structure and function of your brain, slightly increasing your mobility permanently. You might not want to use it more than once.
main.watchdsc: Periodically tells you useful info (bleeding time, hidden infections, weight changes, etc). When used, displays run time and temperature. Having a pocket buddy is comforting!
main.tutorialradiodsc: You're usually given one of these for the training sessions. Not sure if the messages are live or pre-recorded. It has a button you can press.
main.mp3playerdsc: Surprising it still works. Plays/skips a song when used.
main.mushpeardsc: A blue plant part, made to distribute water. Barely edible, with a weird weight-absorbing property and off-putting taste. Lowers body mass when eaten. Seems to have trace opiate concentration.
main.mushtaildsc: The end tail of a mushplant. Contains a chemical which can instantly knock someone out for a while, with a visible mood increase afterwards. Odd. No nutritional value.
main.mushballdsc: A round, edible, bubble-like watery fruit. Looks and feels a little disgusting, but has high water content. Decays very fast.
main.duffelbagdsc: A decently sized bag made of fabric.
main.bikehelmetdsc: A helmet designed to reduce the severity of impacts to the head. Reduces head injuries from falls.
main.headlampdsc: A little flashlight, made to be strapped onto your forehead. Loses battery over time.
main.dustmaskdsc: A slightly sturdy mask that covers your mouth. Offers minor head protection.
main.scarfdsc: Red, warm and fuzzy, providing some insulation from the elements. Makes you feel like a mercenary...
main.blueprintdsc: Has the recipe for some kind of object written on it. There is some kind of electronic chip attached to it... Use to learn the recipe.
main.safetyglassesdsc: A sturdy pair of plastic glasses. Offers minor head protection.
main.autozoomgogglesdsc: A pair of goggles that have the ability to zoom in the user's vision to see farther.
main.blindfolddsc: A black piece of cloth to cover your eyes with. Offers slight protection, but closes your character's eyes.
main.balaclavadsc: A thick, padded piece of cloth to go around your skull. Offers minor protection and decent insulation.
main.latexglovesdsc: A pair of simple latex gloves. Offers minor insulation from the elements.
main.fannypackdsc: A small bag made to be put on your belly.
main.bandolierdsc: A pocketed belt that goes over your shoulder, made to hold ammunition. Can hold firearm rounds.
main.bellyarmordsc: A big piece of metal, made to be strapped on your abdomen. Provides great protection, and some insulation.
main.beltdsc: A leather belt to go over your belly. You could attach something to it.
main.popcorndsc: A bucket containing a bunch of corn kernels, puffed up from being heated. You find it to be quite a novel concept. Tasty.
main.nopopcorndsc: Empty paper bucket. You could store something in it.
main.spacedraindsc: Using advanced teleportation technology, it can drain liquids away from you on use. No one really knows where the lost matter goes... Not like that's your problem, though. Automatically recharges.
main.hoodiedsc: A black, very oversized hoodie that keeps you warm and has a small pocket.
main.metabolismchipdsc: A chip that slightly increases your metabolism, making your limbs regenerate much faster, but using more hunger to do so.
main.xalorisspongedsc: The ripped off, shriveled up spore container of a Xaloris. Can be used a limb to counteract infection or eaten for nutritional value. Its spores might impact your immune system.
main.jetpackdsc: A device worn as a backpack which uses jets to propel the wearer through the air. Has limited fuel and won't work while wet. Hold W to use.
main.dynamitedsc: An explosive made of nitroglycerin, sorbents, and stabilizers. Good for making holes in the terrain. Not very good for your ears.
main.climbingclawsdsc: A pair of steel claws that go over your hands, specifically designed to attach to walls effectively. Grants you the ability to walljump on the same wall indefinitely.
main.plasmacutterdsc: A device that generates a directed flow of plasma. Very good at cutting through metal blocks. Can be used in the health panel to cauterize wounds.
main.grapplinghookdsc: A metal device that launches a hook attached with a rope. The instruction manual is missing.
main.ceftriaxonedsc: A third-generation cephalosporin antibiotic used for the treatment of infections. Increases body immunity for some time. Causes pain.
main.woundgluedsc: A hemostatic, antibiotic glue-like substance. Fights infection, promotes healing and is very effective at sealing bleeding wounds. Might cause circulation problems - use with care.
main.boneweldingtooldsc: A very experimental bit of technology that welds a fracture back together, vastly speeding up healing. Causes some damage to the limb due to the process - better have some dressing ready.
main.paprikashdsc: A paste made from ground fish, rice, tomato paste and vegetable oil, seasoned with onion, salt and spices. It looks and smells rather appealing.
main.carcassdsc: The hard, crushed remains of a sizeable insect. Used in crafting.
main.largecarcassdsc: Two insect carcasses joined together, forming a half-tube shape. Used in crafting.
main.carcasssplintdsc: A hard, long tube made from multiple joined carcasses. Functions as a decent makeshift splint for treating fractures.
main.terrainscannerdsc: Shows you a low-quality map of the terrain below you. Terrain is highlighted in green, solid buildings in red. Goes 24 meters down.
main.bloodcoagulantdsc: A chemical which promotes blood clotting. Globally slows down blood loss, including internal bleeding. Likely to cause clotting. Has an auto-injector.
main.streptokinasedsc: A blood thinner, used to break down blood clots. Highly reduces blood viscosity, but causes nausea and intensifies any bleeding wounds.
main.chestdraindsc: Used to drain fluid from the thorax. Reduces hemothoraces, reusable after some time. Only usable on the chest.
main.tweezersdsc: A simple pair of metal tweezers. Can cleanly and painlessly remove shrapnel from limbs.
main.icepackdsc: A cold bag filled with self-cooling refrigerant gel. Speeds up muscle healing, reduces pain and cools you down slightly. Automatically cools itself over time.
main.armwarmersdsc: A pair of blue arm warmers. Provides some insulation against the cold.
main.carapacedsc: A sturdy steel carapace to protect your thorax. Feels royal.
main.limbwrapsdsc: Makeshift wraps made from gauze to cover the extremities. Slightly protects your arms and feet from damage and makes you feel like a warrior.
main.kneepadsdsc: Plastic pads, made to protect the knees and cushion impacts.
main.plushiedsc: It makes a squeaky noise when you squish it. You could take your frustration out on it when feeling down...
main.tornshirtdsc: An old, torn blue shirt. Provides a small bit of protection and insulation.
main.rangefinderdsc: A device used to measure distances to remote objects. Tells you the distance to whatever you're pointing at when used.
main.mindwipedsc: A specially synthetised drug which completely wipes the brain of most of its memories and past traumas, leaving only a blank emotionless vessel with basic knowledge and survival instincts. Commonly used as a last resort on subjects which are too far gone to function or are at risk of suicide. May also cure cases of moderate-to-severe brain damage. The effect is permanent without extensive rehabilitation. Use as a last resort.
main.scubadivinggeardsc: Lets you indefinitely breathe and regenerate stamina underwater, makes you move faster in liquids and dries you out quickly after resurfacing. The pool floaties are retrofitted.
main.filterstrawdsc: Can be used to safely drink groundwater and reduce the health impact of other liquids when held in the main hand.
main.wrenchdsc: A tool used to provide grip and mechanical advantage in applying torque to turn objects. Can be used on dislocated limbs to correct them more effectively than with your bare hands.
main.bruisekitdsc: A combination of drugs and other medicines, made to aid muscle healing. Increases muscle/skin health and highly aids dislocations. Doesn't affect bleeding.
main.medicalsuturedsc: Used to stitch wounds back together. Instantly stops most bleeding and increases skin health.
main.tourniquetdsc: When applied, it cuts off circulation to the limb, stopping all bleeding in the affected area (though it does not heal the wound). It must be removed after some time, as it causes pain and deprives the limb of oxygen. Reusable.
main.browncapdsc: You aren't sure what kind of fungus it is exactly. For all you know, it could do anything from curing wounds to killing you on the spot.
main.sneakersdsc: A pair of white sneakers, that are not at all made to go over your feet. If you manage to somehow squish your paws in them, provides protection from glass shards.
main.frigiantfruitdsc: A very cold, hard and glassy fruit. Tasty, but has a tendency to cool you down a lot. Consider not consuming it out in the freezing cold.
main.purpleherbdsc: A dry, purple leaf with a coarse texture. Commonly used as an aid for certain afflictions - helps against sickness, slightly helps hearing loss and might lessen internal bleeding. Use with caution - it has a tendency to highly increase the consumer's body temperature.
main.bulbskindsc: An oily piece of thick, yellow plant skin. Contains a high amount of adrenaline and is slightly hydrating, but might minorly affect brain function. Can also be used as a makeshift bandage and limb analgesic.
main.geigefruitdsc: An odd, rectangular shiny fruit. Smells of oil, but tastes nice! Refills hunger and thirst. Can mess with your lungs for a moment, and may randomly help or intensify radiation sickness slightly. Has a loud reaction when impacting the ground at speeds - useful for checking drop height.
main.antisepticmushdsc: Smushed together bits of fruit and foliage, resulting in a mixture effective in treating infections. Lasts one use.
main.striderpeltdsc: A large piece of thick, fluffy white pelt ripped from a snow strider. Offers considerable insulation from the elements.
main.funguschunkdsc: A ripped piece of fungi. Does a decent enough job as food, though you're unsure about the side effects.
main.clottingmushdsc: A small vial of a clot-promoting poultice. While not particularly useful on its own, it could be refined further...
main.bunchunkdsc: A piece of fungus with clot-promoting properties. While not particularly useful on its own, it could be refined further...
main.smallbatterydsc: A small battery that can be inserted into various electronic devices. Stores half as much as a medium battery.
main.mediumbatterydsc: A generic battery that can be inserted into various electronic devices. Stores twice as much as a small battery, but a third as much as a large one.
main.largebatterydsc: A large industrial battery that can be inserted into certain electornic devices. Stores three times as much as a medium battery.
main.pistoldsc: A basic, semi-automatic handgun. Uses small magazines loaded with 9mm rounds. Might jam when wet or low condition. Hold in your main hand to use and see controls.
main.rifledsc: A stockless, fully automatic rifle. Uses rifle magazines loaded with 5.56 rounds. Might jam when wet or low condition. Hold in your main hand to use and see controls.
main.shotgundsc: A stockless, pump-action shotgun with an internal magazine. Uses 12 gauge shells loaded directly into the gun. Might jam when wet or low condition. Hold in your main hand to use and see controls.
main.9mmrounddsc: A small handgun round. Can be loaded into a small magazine, or directly into the chamber if the gun's bolt is open.
main.556rounddsc: A rifle round. Can be loaded into a rifle magazine, or directly into the chamber if the gun's bolt is open.
main.12gaugedsc: A 12 gauge buckshot round. Can be loaded into shotguns, or directly into the chamber if the gun's bolt is open.
main.boxof12gaugedsc: A box that can store sixteen 12-Gauge rounds. Use to unload a shell to insert into a firearm.
main.smallmagazinedsc: A universal handgun magazine that accepts 9mm rounds.
main.riflemagazinedsc: A universal rifle magazine that accepts 5.56 rounds.
main.magazinebasedsc: A specially shaped container with a spring in it. Used in magazine and firearm making.
main.makeshiftrifledsc: An improvised bolt-action firearm, made of scrapped together tubes and gun scraps. Uses small magazines loaded with 9mm rounds. Might jam when wet or low condition. Hold in your main hand to use and see controls.
main.casingdsc: Spent casing. While it's not of much use anymore, you could reuse it in crafting.
main.keratinboosterdsc: A bottle filled with a modified growth hormone that specifically targets keratin in order to encourage its growth. Makes your claws regrow faster for some time.

buildings.fungalibungalidsc: A small patch of greenish mushrooms. You might be able to harvest one of the caps if you're lucky.
buildings.mushroomplatformdsc: A sturdy piece of fungi you can stand on.
buildings.drillpoddsc: Used for transporting people long distances through solid ground. While it's not in a functional state, you could get it working if you bring a piece of metal alloy. Can be used to skip 2 layers downwards.
buildings.drillpoddscfixed:
Used for transporting people long distances through solid ground.

Crouch inside it to skip 2 layers downwards. Might cause some hearing loss, as the soundproofing is worn out.
buildings.frigiantdsc: An icy, glassy plant. A spherical bulb is hanging from it.
buildings.snowstriderdsc: A large, fluffy creature that hunts for food in the cold regions of this cave system. Its thick pelt keeps it warm.
buildings.spaceheaterdsc: A device that strongly heats the area around it. Might induce minor radiation sickness if you're too close for too long. You could cook raw meat with it.
buildings.xalorisdsc: A spongy and brambly fern that heats up the air around it to spread spores to its surroundings. Keeps the cold at bay, but breathing in the spores for too long might mess with your immune system.
buildings.lifepodheaterdsc: Keeps the inside nice and cozy.
buildings.beartrapdsc: It has a set of two jaws spiked with teeth.
buildings.bioterminaldsc: A computer terminal with a plate under it and writing that reads "Insert human DNA sample to continue..."
buildings.lifepodshowerdsc: Provides a one-time spray of antiseptic cleaning foam.
buildings.BloodCrystaldsc: It seems to be moist with yellow liquid, releasing it into anything around it.
buildings.cactusdsc: Back up there, you were told these are supposed to be green. They didn't lie about it being prickly at least.
buildings.coildsc: Good for instantly frying anything conductive.
buildings.wallbiterdsc: A concerningly large, fluffy, six legged beast. You can see what looks like sharp teeth sticking out. Seems to be moving around erratically.
buildings.thornbackyoungdsc: A young, fluffy and very much aggressive thornback. They seemingly enjoy tunneling through the ground and ripping apart any moving thing nearby.
buildings.overgrowntickdsc: A cave tick that had way too much food and space to grow. As aggressive as usual.
buildings.DigestionCrystaldsc: It has a weird look and feel to it.
buildings.dropcapsuledsc: An artificial warmth emanates from it.
buildings.lifepodbuttonheatdsc: A red, cheap looking button. This one toggles the lifepod heater and A/C. It's currently set to <>.
buildings.lifepodbuttonshowerdsc: A red, cheap looking button. This one activates the lifepod's cleaning and disinfecting gas shower.
buildings.EmissiveCrystaldsc: A rather bright light emanates from it.
buildings.geotreedsc: It's squishy! Has weirdly geometrical leaf-looking things on it.
buildings.glowplantdsc: A green, bioluminescent plant. It seems to be rather unfazed by the environment.
buildings.jumppaddsc: It has a pressure plate on it.
buildings.leadbushdsc: It has pieces of heavy metal growing on it. While it looks like a plant, it's actually an animal!
buildings.lifepodchestdsc: Likely to contain basic survival gear.
buildings.LifePodLightdsc: Has a lightbulb in it - you could probably take it.
buildings.medicalstationdsc: While it seems to have mostly lost its purpose by now, it can still give you a hearty one-time dose of goodness.
buildings.mushplantdsc: It's twitching slowly... It looks moist.
buildings.OxygenCrystaldsc: It seems to be slowly bubbling...
buildings.reinforceddoordsc: Can probably be opened by something...
buildings.sandrosedsc: An oddly beautiful plant with a few large, oblong shapes growing on it.
buildings.scrapeaterdsc: It has a label on it that reads "Insert scrap to open", with a small monitor next to it displaying <color=#ffffff>"<>%".
buildings.shuttledoordsc: A big piece of metal to keep outside things outside and inside things, inside.
buildings.shuttleelevatordsc: The time you've spent sitting on this thing makes up a concerning percent of your entire lifetime.
buildings.spikestabberdsc: Looks scary. You could probably deactivate it...
buildings.stoneplantdsc: It's a clump of hard, stone-like material with squishy green blobs stuck onto it.
buildings.turretdsc: Seems to have some sort of heat detector on it.
buildings.stalactitedsc: It seems loosely connected to the ceiling.
buildings.icestalactitedsc: It seems loosely connected to the ceiling.
buildings.stalactitedscdropped: It, in fact, is no longer connected to the ceiling.
buildings.drybushdsc: You have a sneaking suspicion that it's dead.
buildings.brownshroomdsc: You can't say much more about it other than the fact that it is, in fact, brown.
buildings.spentfueldsc: An oddly terrifying energy emanates from it.
buildings.soundcannondsc: You should probably cover your ears if you hear it charging.
buildings.traderdsc: Another unlucky victim. At least they're still breathing.
buildings.traderdscdead: They're not breathing anymore. Thanks to you.
buildings.bananaplantdsc: A short, wide plant, colloquially called the "Banana Plant" due to its mushy, yellow top. Very slippery to step on.
buildings.geyserdsc: An unstable geyser with a tendency to shoot out water. Luckily, it's room temperature at worst.
buildings.oilpipedsc: A rusty pipe with a dark tar pouring from it. You don't want to look inside... Will probably flood the area given enough time.
buildings.plantiationdsc: A long, dull purple colored plant, with a large semi-transparent bulb growing on the end.
buildings.mushroomdropperdsc: A fungus that releases its cap to spread its spores around any unfortunate passerbys.
buildings.mushroomdropperpayloaddsc: It's the part that falls down and hurts.
buildings.sidestabberdsc: An odd animal fused with a fungus. Launches a large spike at any passing prey.

moodles.deaddsc: Permanent, irreversible, and complete loss of brain function. You have left this world behind, alike the rest.
moodles.braindamage2dsc: Strong mental deficit. Ability to think intelligently and self-sustain is limited. Serious brain damage present.
moodles.braindamage1dsc: Mentally impaired from damage to the brain. You feel weirdly confused...
moodles.cantbreathedsc: Suffocating! Loss of consciousness and death imminent if untreated.
moodles.thoraxdestroyeddsc: Your lungs are too damaged to function, caused by critically low thorax muscle health. Asphyxiation imminent.
moodles.oxygen1dsc: Lowered blood oxygen. Slightly confused, with rubbery skin. Something's wrong...
moodles.oxygen2dsc: Not enough oxygen is circulating around the body. Feeling light-headed and numb in the extremities. Something is very wrong.
moodles.oxygen3dsc: Consciousness lost. Tissues deprived of oxygen. Brain damage imminent.
moodles.oxygen4dsc: Heart stopped. Brain dying from oxygen deprivation. Your entire body is rapidly shutting down; Death imminent.
moodles.pain2dsc: Hurting a decent bit. Unhappiness rising slowly.
moodles.pain3dsc: Half-conscious, mind fogged by intense pain. Unhappiness rising.
moodles.pain4dsc: Mind-shattering pain. Movement compromised. Death sounds preferable right about now. Unhappiness rising quickly.
moodles.overdose1dsc: Relaxed and calm. Your body feels numb.
moodles.overdose2dsc: Very relaxed and calm, but your lungs feel heavy. A little more tired than usual. This feels pretty good, for now...
moodles.overdose3dsc: Breathing is difficult, but your mind is in euphoria. This definitely isn't healthy. If only it could last forever...
moodles.overdose4dsc: Respiratory failure. You are leaving this world in a drug-filled euphoria. Brain damage and death imminent.
moodles.withdrawal2dsc: Your body is desperate for another hit. You want to vomit... This feels really bad. Treatment recommended.
moodles.withdrawal3dsc: You are struggling to hold yourself together, shaking, desperate for any sort of relief. It feels horrible. Treatment needed.
moodles.withdrawal4dsc: Your body is failing to sustain itself without the opiates it became so reliant on. Your heart is struggling to pump oxygen around the body, resulting in hypoxic brain damage during a desperate episode.
moodles.drugoverdosedsc: You have overdosed on a non-opioid drug. Health complications likely.
moodles.bleeding1dsc: Blood is oozing out of a relatively small wound. There is no immediate danger.
moodles.bleeding2dsc: Blood is flowing out of a decently sized wound. Unlikely to be fatal if you're healthy. Treatment recommended.
moodles.bleeding3dsc: A large volume of blood is haemorrhaging out of your body. Likely lethal if untreated. Treatment needed.
moodles.bleeding4dsc: Blood is spraying out of you like water out of a fire hose. Death imminent. Treatment critical!
moodles.internalBleeddsc: Turns out your guts and lungs are NOT where the blood is supposed to be. Treatment recommended.
moodles.lowbloodvolume1dsc: Minor blood loss. You're feeling a little weak, with pale skin under your fur.
moodles.lowbloodvolume2dsc: Weak and confused from blood loss. You feel really unwell. Treatment recommended.
moodles.lowbloodvolume3dsc: Missing a major amount of blood, barely conscious. Your vision is fuzzy... Treatment needed.
moodles.lowbloodvolume4dsc: Life-threatening blood loss, about to pass out. Moments away from total heart failure. Death imminent.
moodles.highbloodvolume2dsc: Body bloated, blood pressure high, feeling dizzy with a headache.
moodles.highbloodvolume3dsc: Grossly bloated. Extremely high blood pressure. Can barely stand, or think.
moodles.highbloodvolume4dsc: There's a terrible pain in your chest... Vital signs fading. Blood volume and pressure way too high.
moodles.exertion2dsc: Uncomfortably exerted, struggling to move and work. (<>%)
moodles.exertion3dsc: Barely able to move, highly physically exerted. (<>%)
moodles.brokenbonedsc: You broke something. Try not to use the affected limb, and rest as much as possible. Treatment highly recommended.
moodles.dislocationdsc: You dislocated something. Try not to use the affected limb, and find a way to fix it. Treatment recommended.
moodles.brokenneckdsc: Your neck is broken. Your spinal cord isn't severed, but any amount of moving around will be agonizing. Physically weaker from the neck down. Eating is painful.
moodles.brokenribsdsc: Your ribs are broken, making breathing painful and way harder. Hope none of them punctured your lungs. Weakened arm strength.
moodles.dislocatedjawdsc: Your jaw is dislocated, impairing your speech and making eating anything extremely painful.
moodles.dislocatedspinedsc: Your spine is dislocated. Your spinal cord isn't severed, but moving your body at all is really painful. Physically weaker from the waist down.
moodles.infected1dsc: The infection site is swollen and warm. Treatment needed. Find something that can kill off foreign bodies.
moodles.infected2dsc: The infection site is leaking dark pus, and is swelling more. Treatment needed.
moodles.infected3dsc: The infection is spreading across the limb quickly and painfully. Chances of going into sepsis. Urgent treatment needed.
moodles.infected4dsc: The infection is spreading to other limbs, and the infected limb is starting to undergo necrosis. Sepsis is setting in. Emergency care needed.
moodles.sepsis1dsc: A widespread infection is causing your body to react badly. You feel confused, with lowered blood pressure and a fever. Lethal if progresses.
moodles.sepsis2dsc: Increased heart rate, lowered blood pressure, lightheadedness and a strong fever. Signs of organ dysfunction. Likely to soon enter septic shock.
moodles.sepsis3dsc: Critically low blood pressure and multiple organ dysfunction syndrome caused by sepsis. Death is fast approaching.
moodles.concussiondsc: Rendered unconscious by low head vitality - you will wake up when your head heals.
moodles.unconsciousdsc: Not responding to any external stimuli. Lights out.
moodles.incapacitateddsc: Can't stand or think. You barely feel anything.
moodles.confused2dsc: Confused and dizzy, struggling to keep up with the world around you.
moodles.confused3dsc: Barely conscious, feeling like you could collapse at any moment.
moodles.tired4dsc: Barely awake, about to collapse from exhaustion.
moodles.hunger1dsc: Could do with a bite to eat.
moodles.hunger2dsc: Uncomfortably hungry. Slightly weaker than usual.
moodles.hunger3dsc: Extremely hungry, desperate for satiation. Weaker than usual.
moodles.hunger4dsc: Your entire body, just wasting away... Total organ failure imminent.
moodles.hunger5dsc: Eating good today! Lowered weight loss rate and mobility. Slight happiness increase.
moodles.hunger6dsc: Stomach totally stuffed with food! Any more and you'll be sick. Greatly lowered weight loss rate and mobility. Happiness increase.
moodles.thirst2dsc: Low body water volume. Very thirsty.
moodles.thirst3dsc: Body drying out, in desperate need of water. Mind consumed by thirst.
moodles.thirst4dsc: Blood getting dangerously viscous attributable to a lack of fluids. Heart failure imminent.
moodles.sick2dsc: Confused, uncomfortable around the stomach. Prone to vomiting.
moodles.sick3dsc: Lethargic, tired and in major discomfort. Very prone to vomiting.
moodles.sick4dsc: Dangerously sick. Something is VERY wrong on the inside. Weak, confused and in a world of pain.
moodles.hot3dsc: Dangerously hot. You're struggling to go on in the heat... Thirst highly increased.
moodles.hot4dsc: Cells are starting to die from the intense heat. Irreversible organ damage imminent.
moodles.cold2dsc: Unpleasantly cold. Your body is slowing down.
moodles.cold3dsc: Dangerously low temperature, body and mind taken by the cold. Your entire body is slowly shutting down.
moodles.cold4dsc: You will soon fall asleep and never wake up. Goodnight.
moodles.wet2dsc: Considerably wet. Temperature and comfort decreased.
moodles.wet3dsc: Dripping wet. Temperature and comfort considerably decreased.
moodles.wet4dsc: Completely drenched! The water is weighing you down. Temperature and comfort highly decreased.
moodles.underweight1dsc: Try to pack on a few kilos.
moodles.underweight2dsc: Unhealthily underweight considering your species. Weaker than normal. Lowered carrying capacity.
moodles.underweight3dsc: You're dangerously thin and frail. Way weaker than normal, prone to being tired and lethargic. Lowered carrying capacity.
moodles.underweight4dsc: You're excessively skinny. You can easily see and feel your bones through your fur. At high risk of heart failure. Very lowered carrying capacity.
moodles.overweight1dsc: Try to lose a few kilos.
moodles.overweight2dsc: Unhealthily overweight, though you look about average compared to other species. Clumsier, you get tired quicker.
moodles.overweight3dsc: Dangerously wide and soft. Way clumsier and more prone to exhaustion.
moodles.overweight4dsc: Life-threatingly obese. It's like you stuffed a bag of fur with pure fat and hunger. At high risk of heart failure.
moodles.depression1dsc: Starting to realize the gravity of your situation. Try to distract yourself.
moodles.depression2dsc: Lacking the motivation to go on, struggling with emotions. Things really aren't looking up. Find a way to distract yourself.
moodles.depression3dsc: Barely willing to do anything. Your mind, ravaged by desperation. Maybe it will all be over soon?
moodles.depression4dsc: If this place doesn't end your desolate life soon, you will. Anything, anything to forget reality...
moodles.trauma1dsc: Something bad has happened to you, and your brain does NOT want to experience it again. Happiness slightly reduced.
moodles.trauma2dsc: Recent events have left you uneasy and scarred. You feel shaky. You REALLY don't want to go through that again. Happiness reduced.
moodles.trauma3dsc: You feel panicked and horrified. Visions of past horrors flash before your eyes. You want OUT of here by any means necessary... This wound will take a good while to heal. Happiness highly reduced.
moodles.trauma4dsc: Horrified. Helpless. Hopeless. You can't muster a single word. Happiness severely reduced.
moodles.happy2dsc: Looking forward to what's around the corner.
moodles.happy3dsc: You've found peace in this strange land.
moodles.happy4dsc: You're at the top of the world, shaping the way forward at your will. Nothing can stop you!
moodles.impairedspeechdsc: Something is making speaking difficult... You might have trouble communicating with others.
moodles.deaf2dsc: You can't hear those high frequencies as well as before. Let your ears rest for a while.
moodles.deaf3dsc: Everything sounds very muffled and echo-y. You feel irritated. This may take a bit.
moodles.deaf4dsc: You can barely hear anything. You feel very irritated. Your ears will take a good while to improve.
moodles.autopumpdsc: Oxygen and awareness levels kept at sustainable levels by a life support machine. (<>)
moodles.encumbered1dsc: Carrying a bit much for comfort. <> encumbrance.
moodles.encumbered2dsc: Carrying too much. Stamina and mobility decreased. <> encumbrance.
moodles.encumbered3dsc: Carrying way too much. Stamina and mobility highly decreased. <> encumbrance.
moodles.encumbered4dsc: Practically unable to move. Carrying WAY, way too much. <> encumbrance.
moodles.irradiated2dsc: Feverish and nauseous. Your skin feels hot and painful. Something is very wrong. It's terrifying.
moodles.irradiated3dsc: Horribly sick and aching all over. Breathing and thinking is extremely difficult. You feel abhorrent.
moodles.irradiated4dsc: Not going gently into that goodnight.
moodles.hemothoraxdsc: Blood is accumulating in the pleural cavity due to internal bleeding. Your chest hurts... Treatment needed.
moodles.badsleepdsc: Your back really isn't appreciating your choice of where you slept. Try picking a less harsh surface next time. Consciousness decreased.
moodles.laststanddsc: You're not going down that easily. Something deep inside you compels you to push through.
moodles.dirty2dsc: While you don't particularly mind the lack of hygiene, your immune system certainly will. Take a bath. (<>%)
moodles.adrenalinedsc: Pain numbed. You're on high alert.
moodles.tachycardiadsc: Your heart rate feels abnormally high.
moodles.bradycardiadsc: Your heart rate feels abnormally low.
moodles.rnrsdsc: Neural shock caused by a sudden and rapid regeneration of brain tissue. While you'll adjust after some time, you might not want to take another dose for now. (<>)
moodles.rippedjawdsc: Your lower jaw has been ripped off due severe trauma to the head. Eating and talking is much harder. You are horribly scarred by the experience.
moodles.rippedeyedsc: One of your eyes has been ripped out, halving your field of view. You are somewhat scarred by the experience. Don't lose the remaining one.
moodles.rippedeyesdsc: Both of your eyes have been ripped out. You can only get by using feel and sound. At least you no longer need a light source...
moodles.lowimmunitydsc: Your immune system is severely weakened, be it due to dirtyness, hunger, thirst or more. Infections are much more dangerous. Take better care of yourself.
moodles.highimmunitydsc: Your immune system is working at high capacity, likely due to antibiotics. Infections are much less dangerous, and might even regress on their own if near 200%.
moodles.amputationdsc: One of your extremities has been dismembered. Traumatizing. Obviously, any use of the lobbed off limb is permanently gone.
moodles.clawdamage1dsc: Your claws are worn down from continuous use, reducing your damage output. Give your hands a break, or use a tool.
moodles.clawdamage2dsc: Your claws are severely damaged from excessive use, severely reducing your damage output. You might damage your hands if you keep using them without a tool.
moodles.keratinboosterdsc: Your claws regrow three times as fast. (<>)

other.waterdsc: Slightly dirty groundwater. Mostly safe to drink, though slightly sickening.
other.dirtywaterdsc: Atleast it's not on your body anymore.
other.algaedsc: Water with dense, bioluminescent algae growing in it. Very buoyant.
other.oildsc: A thick, black tar. Difficult to move through.
other.sapdsc: A thick, tasty sap, produced by jungle trees. Very sugary.
other.liquiddescription: Crouch and stand still to drink

other.radiationlinedsc: Line of radiation forces you down

Click and drag the dressing around the limb to bandage.
You don't have to use the entire bandage.

other.savecontinuedsc:
Keep going.
You can only save and resume the run at layer transitions. Dying or quitting mid-layer will erase your progress.

other.ripclothingtip: Drag items here to rip them into dressings

Hold to inject
Check label for dosage info

other.fixdislocationdsc: Try to correct the dislocation by hand
other.removesplintdsc: Take off the splint from the limb
other.removeshrapneldsc: Try to remove shrapnel by hand

other.napinfo: Can't sleep if in pain/sick/not tired
other.napinfo2: Sleep quality is determined by the ground you sleep on
other.tutexp3: The things they're trying to hammer into us are concerning...
other.tutexp5: I'll wait for now, you should go.
other.tut1: Welcome! This is the final general training area.
other.tut1b: Pay attention to me, as I will not repeat myself.
other.tut2: Proceed to the right. Move with (A/D).
other.tut3: Use (SPACE) to jump. Jump on walls to walljump. Hold to jump higher.
other.tut5: You can only walljump once per side. Chain alternating walljumps to climb further up.
other.tut7: You can carry a few things on you at a time. Most item interactions are done with (RIGHT CLICK).
other.tut8: (RIGHT CLICK) on your body to open the inventory. Drag me outside with (RIGHT CLICK) to drop me and continue.
other.tut8b: You can close the inventory either by clicking (RMB) outside of the radial, (TAB), or by dragging an item to the edge of the screen.
other.tut9: (RIGHT CLICK) me and drag me onto yourself, and then a slot. Put me in your main hand.
other.tut10: Most usable items are used in the inventory. Drag me into the center to use me. Use me to continue.
other.tut11: You can switch items in your hands by pressing (Q).
other.tut12: This can save you a bit of time. Switch hands to continue.
other.tut13: You can drop items in your MAIN hand by pressing (T). Tap it to drop, hold it to throw.
other.tut14: THROW me at that lamp next to the door to continue.
other.tut15: Now, eat the food item that just hit the floor next to you.
other.tut16: Note: some items (like tools) can be used from the main hand.
other.tut16b: Your secondary hand will be used if the main one is broken, and the mouth if both hands are gone.
other.tut16c: Pick me back up to continue onwards.
other.tut17: Uh oh! Suppose something went wrong during an expedition, and your arm started bleeding.
other.tut18: Let's see what's going on with you. Open the health panel with (R) (or pressing the heart button).
other.tut20: Tell you what, you're going to fix it. Close the health panel.
other.tut21: See that bandage next to you? Mouse over it while holding (SHIFT). It says "usable in health panel".
other.tut22: Some medical items can be used either in the hand (inventory) or in the health panel. Pick it up.
other.tut24: (RIGHT CLICK) drag the bandage onto the limb. Keep using the bandage it until the bleeding stops. For now, the bandage is infinite.
other.tut25: Well done! However, it appears your arm is infected now. Normally you won't be notified about it immediately.
other.tut26: Close the health panel and go to the right.
other.tut27: Infections need to be regularly taken care of, as they will usually not resolve on their own.
other.tut28: There's a bottle of antiseptic right there. Read what it does and pick it up to continue.
other.tut29: Use the antiseptic on the infected limb.
other.tut29b: As long as you keep the limb disinfected, it should heal with time. The arrow next to the icon shows if the infection is progressing or regressing.
other.tut29c: Disinfections do not stack, so don't bother spraying it many times at once. Do it regularly instead.
other.tut30: Remember, being well fed and in good physical condition helps keep your immunity up. Proceed to the right.
other.tut31: You'll need to crouch going through here. Hold (S).
other.tut32: Containers are essential for letting you store things. There's one right in front of you!
other.tut33: Drag me into that trash bag. I won't take it personally.
other.tut34: Now, quickly (RIGHT CLICK) the container to see its contents, and drag me out of it.
other.tut35: You're a natural! Remember, you can't use items in the health panel if they're in a container. Proceed to the left.
other.tut36: Knowledge is key! Mouse over items and statuses (bottom left), to read what they do.
other.tut37: (LEFT CLICK) will make you swing if you're unarmed/holding something not usable from the main hand.
other.tut38: Use this to destroy things. Try to keep mining to a minimum, it's slow and will exert you fast.
other.tut39: Some conditions like pain or exhaustion will take a while to go away. Speed up time (1-3) to make them go by faster.
other.tut41: You can sleep with the button in the lower right of the health panel. Don't sleep on the cold hard floor; things like rubber are much comfier.
other.tut42: Procuring things on your own can be useful at times.
other.tut42a: Here are 2 pieces of foliage. You'll tie them together into some rope.
other.tut42ab: Open the crafting menu, drag them into the ingredients field and create.
other.tut42ac: Well done. Remember, ingredient order doesn't matter.
other.tut42ad: You can see other recipes by dragging an item to the see recipes box.
other.tut42ae: Crafting is useful for making basic resources and refining certain items into better versions.
other.tut42b: Being in a bad spot might seriously lower your morale. Try to keep yourself happy. Things like a good diet always help.
other.tut43: This concludes the final revisional training. Please walk over to the yellow device on the far end of the corridor.
other.tut44: Further instructions will be given once you awaken. Refer to the controls page if needed. Good luck.

other.startlorenote:
Year 2XXX 
<>
Humanity has technologically progressed to a significant extent. 
<>
One corporation began to put research into bio-engineering, combining animal and human DNA. 
<>
This lead to their creation of the Experiment species, along with dozens of later offshoots. 
<>
After years of unethical private testing in labs, they set their sights on something bigger. 
<>
They knew of a gray planet with thriving flora, fauna and an easy space travel path. 
<>
Soon, thousands of specimens, buildings and miscellaneous cargo were sent. 
<>
While most was shipped correctly, a large amount of cargo was mistakenly sent to the planet's expansive cave network due to a calibration error. 
<>
This includes a mistakenly sent piece of important experimental technology, which now sat deep in the underground systems, without an easy way to get it back. 
<>
This, however, was seen as an opportunity by the scientists to do more behavioural research by sending thousands of specimens down to retrieve the lost tech. 
<>
The chance of it working were low, but shipment is cheap and their breathing fodder is plenty. 
<>
You are one unlucky specimen.
Resistance is not an option.

seeGravel: I didn't want to do this...
This looks... Grayer than I anticipated.
'Kay. I need to go... down. Straight down.
Aye! Let's not waste any time.
They really didn't leave anything in my pod...
At least I had food and shelter up there...
I'm already missing my peers from up there.
I don't think they can monitor me down here... Right...?
I have to go... Down. Straight down.
I hope I'll get to see my friends again.
It's nice not seeing white tiles around for once...
Wasn't I supposed to get supplies...?
Let's hope I remember my training...
Haven't seen those open in a while.
God. This is going to be fucking horrible.
Go down... Get the thing if I find it... Okay...
seeModifier: Jeez, it's REALLY foggy down here!
Feels a bit toasty in here... Moreso than I would have expected.
Geez, this place is SO hot... Huff... What happened here..?
It feels a little more nippy than usual in here...

Get that gun away from me, this isn't an active shootout. Anyway...
Are you TRYING to make yourself a threat to me or do you just think the gun looks cool..?
tradermeetimpairedspeech: What are you saying..? I can't understand you.
Your speech is extremely muffled. Just letting you know.
I can barely make out what you're saying to me.
traderseehurt: You appear to be injured and bleeding... You can take a bandage if you wish.
Ew! Please don't bleed all over my floor. Grab a bandage and treat yourself if you see one, mine are free.
That doesn't look good... You may take a bandage for free if you can find one on me.
traderlightbreak: Oh, you idiot! Leave, now! OUT!
EY! Fuck you! Get the fuck out!
Why the fuck would you do that!? Get out! I needed that light!
Why are you destroying my pod!? Get OUT! LEAVE!

notes.Item1: this is horrifying. there's so many corpses... im scared. why did they send so many of us here? i dont understand. i really dont understand. they knocked me out cold with some kind of dart and forced me into a pod to be sent here. i hate this planet.

I inquired others around the ability to see our physical status in our minds, and it turns out this is something shared by almost everyone else here. Quite interesting - this is not something we've ever been able to do back in our homes. Have we been implanted with something? There are no visible attachments on any of us. I have also noted that very few people here do not share this experience, seemingly lacking whatever lets us do this. Odd.
i keep losing weight. i need to eat more to stay in shape. all this running around makes you consume calories really fast. i guess i need to be full more often.
this is horrible. this is fucking horrible. i cant do it anymore. this is a death mission. abandon all hope. there is no point to this

i dont get why we're here. what for? i know im supposed to retrieve some kind of battery cell or something. im assuming others have the same mission. arent there more efficient ways of doing this? logically? why send us here. i miss my friends. i dont want to die.
i fell down. bad. my leg is mangled. this is really bad. trying to move at all is a pain. i need some painkillers for this.

i overheard our captors calling us a mutated amalgamation of a "human, fox and rat", whatever any of that means. how much is there being kept from us? information wise? the thought scares me. ive never considered anything being outside of where we were raised. and now im here. i cant wrap my head around all of this.
(On the paper is what looks to be a self-portrait.)

I have found drawing to be a decent escape to the situation I have found myself in. It seems all of us are struggling with our mental states, one way or another. It is nice to get a distraction from the harsh reality at times.

planet is good .  eat a lot of good flesh .  dune happy
(You can make out what looks like a very poorly made self-portrait.)

The distribution of species here seems very disproportional. The Experiments are everywhere, yet other species like ours seem to be much lesser in numbers. Odd... Either way, I dislike the amount of casualties here. More of us need to be helped.

ugh, this place sucks. i keep being bitten by random spiders i cant see in time. i think theyre venomous, as they leave nasty looking infected wounds in me... the glowplant fruit do help with those though
the red blinking lights in the dark are spike traps. watch out for them. please. please. someone just walked into one in the distance, i just heard a yelp and silence after. stay safe
its cold here. so cold. much colder than our previous home. honestly, i like it. bathing in the pools feels nice, its refreshing. im liking this vacation

i met up with someone, we agreed to try to go out to the surface through one of those holes to the outside. my friend stepped out first, and immediately they started stumbling in shock. they seemed to be in a lot of pain. they vomited a bunch, then collapsed and stopped breathing soon after. their skin started blistering too, especially around the head and neck. something is preventing us from leaving. im scared.

Getting wet seems to be rather dangerous if you're not careful. The temperature here is much lower than at our home, and it seems being drenched for too long can get us in a hypothermic state. Try doing some physical exercise if you need to warm up quickly, I've discovered that helps.
i really need to stop losing my lights. anything does the job, even those weird glowy plant things. i keep leaving and forgetting about them, then tripping up and getting hurt by accident. not good.

apparently those boxes with the weird computers next to them can be opened if you spill some red blood on them. it has to specifically be red blood, otherwise it wont work. it has some crates inside, you can open them and take stuff with you. useful.

Investigating the chemical composition of the different colored blood bags I have found here, it seems they are considerably different in their composition. The red blood is completely different than ours and the blood that the creatures here possess. It seems to be somewhat metallic in composition for whatever reason, how odd. Better not use that on ourselves.

(There is a poorly made drawing of what looks to be one of your captors. They are holding what you can make out as a taser. Their face is scratched out with a big X. The weapon brings back horrible memories.)

i almost drowned just a moment ago. ive never swam before, and its very exhausting. its hard to keep myself above the surface when im tired. i imagine sinking forever to be pretty painful... be careful.

overhearing a little bit from our captors, apparently the cargo we are supposed to get is some kind "advanced energy source". something about storing a large amount of power and distributing it "wirelessy". i do not know what most of that means, but maybe it will be useful to know. stay safe

Recently found a drill of sorts, but it's missing a few parts. I can't seem to figure out what it needs, aside from the covering panel for all the mechanisms... Could prove helpful if I was to get it to a working state.

ugh. its so hot in here. really need to space out my movements and be careful as to not fall numb from the heat. ive found that taking dives in the water pools here helps... maybe even the brown ones if desperate.

There seems to be a high amount of radioactive waste in this area. While that does make it difficult to navigate, we should keep in mind that we can take brief doses of ionizing radiation without too much issue, as long as the exposure doesn't last too long. We're already riddled with cancer due to presumably being unnatural, thus the effect on our entire lifespan is negligible.
dune see big monster. motivated to kill      dune chase monster and kill and eat . great food . great hunter of beast !

way too cold in here. have to try my best to not get wet at all, or ill be in big trouble. lucky us, there are a lot of those weird sporey plants that give off some heat, along with those weird machines. run between those when possible, i guess. better not get stuck in the freezing cold.

It's odd how it rains here. I've never actually seen real rain before... It's rather pretty, even if unsanitary. I still wonder how it is possible for there to be such a higher water concentration down here. Perhaps, the water from the above ice cap is dripping down to here?
